summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing the China Investment Corporation's plans to establish an international office in London. It highlights CIC's recent activities and considerations regarding potential locations for their overseas base, including London, New York, and Hong Kong.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email discussing investment opportunities and the China Investment Corporation.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email from Epstein, indicating a professional relationship.

persons.name: Michael Charlton
persons.context: Charlton is mentioned as discussing CIC's potential investment and operations in London.

connections.description: Epstein is communicating with Staley regarding investment opportunities.
Charlton is in talks with CIC about setting up an international operation in London.

keyFacts: The China Investment Corporation (CIC) is considering establishing its first international office in London.
CIC has $200 billion at its disposal and has been active in the UK capital.
CIC was part of a consortium that carried out a $1.3 billion bail-out of Canary Wharf.
Michael Charlton is in talks with CIC regarding their potential operations in London.
CIC is also considering New York and Hong Kong as alternatives for their overseas base.
